intro: Asplundia allenii, commonly known as the Allen's arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many species with showy inflorescences. The plant produces a striking, spatulate-shaped leaf that can grow up to 1 meter in length. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and are borne on a spadix, characteristic of the Araceae family. Asplundia allenii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
